quest_name: Mission? Well, look straight ahead. Now give me a

history.location_text:
Mission? Well, look straight ahead. Now give me a jump... higher! Even higher! One step forward. Squat down, stand up straight. One jump forward, one jump back - don't turn! Stand up, stop wincing and nursing your tail base... Not bad at all.

I think you are the one we need, Ranger. Our scholars invented a unique device, which was sent to the Institute of Inventions and Innovations on planet Bonnasis for patenting. Unfortunately, we didn't have time to test it thoroughly so now we can't complete the application for the patent. There is only one test remaining - field-testing - but it is the most important one. We have already rented a test lab in the Institute and invited stuntmen but they failed to complete the testing.

As a ranger, you must be perfectly trained. We will even pay you twice as much as a stuntman gets - it makes 65535 cr, if you go to planet Bonnasis (system Procyon) and manage to test the device. But keep in mind that the patent submission is due to expire, so you must do all the testing by 6 February 3000.
history.reasoning: (auto-selected single choice)

history.location_text:
You took an aerocab that brought you to the Inventions and Innovations. It was near the Academy of Anthropological and Amorphous Anomalies. You entered and asked which way you should go.

A gloomy assistant accompanied you along the tortuous corridors. You met a Maloq with a stunt man's badge hopping with his crutches, then they carried by a litter with an unconscious man - your colleague. A gaal in a wheelchair saw where you were going. Then he approached you, gave you a sympathising look, and mentioned quietly: "Heh, he's so young", - after that he wheeled away.

The assistant brought you to the "Test laboratory No 13" and kindly opened the door.
- Ranger? - a fae stood up to meet you. - Nice to meet you, I'm professor Hab, I manage the testing of the device and collect all the information necessary for the patent application preparation. Have a sit.
You sat obediently on the offered chair.
- Stand up, now sit down again. Bounce on your toes. Higher. Still higher! Now hold your breath. Hold your left ear with your right hand and the right ear with your left hand... Not mine!!!
He measured your pulse and nodded with satisfaction.
- Excellent. Pulse, co-ordination, reflexes  - you are in perfect shape and this is very important for the "Jumper"'s testing. By the way, you may breathe.

You exhaled with relief:
choices: What exactly am I supposed to do?
history.reasoning: (auto-selected single choice)

history.location_text:
- You must test the jumping backpack - "Jumper". We rented a pavilion for the testing and tossed a facility. Your task is to go through the labyrinth made of hanging platforms jumping from one platform to another using the "Jumper". The labyrinth consists of the starting and finishing points and five rows of platforms between them.  Your task is to make a number of jumps to get from the starting point through the labyrinth to the finishing point . And you can jump only within the row you are at or onto the platforms of the next row.

Jumps require power consumption, which is measured in ergo and depends on the length of the jump. You will have two batteries  20 ergo each. One battery is active, and the other is spare. Our technicians promise that would be enough.

There are additional devices somewhere on the platforms, which allow you to replace the active battery, top it up or even get back to the starting point where you can charge the both batteries and start the testing from the very beginning. If you want to cancel the testing and, accordingly, abandon your fee, you can use the emergency return button.
choices: Take me to the scaffold... I mean, to the testing facility. I agree to stretch my legs a little bit... Lord forbid, of course!
Please give me more details about the labyrinth's configuration and explain how I can go through it.
What is the power consumption during jumping?
You said something about additional devices in the labyrinth...
Please tell me once again -what is my task?
Can you tell me more about the "Jumper"? What's the hang of this device?
What are your guarantees? Have you experienced any accidents?
Oh, no - the disability pension is not big enough to affect grasshopper.

Previous failures indicate that navigating without a precise understanding of the distances and special devices (specifically the Accelerator on Platform 1 and the charger on Violet-3) leads to energy depletion. Before starting, I need to confirm the power consumption mechanics and the nature of the "additional devices" mentioned in the intro. Specifically, I need to know the cost of jumping within a row versus jumping to the next row, as the Accelerator likely modifies these values. I will start by gathering all technical specifications to ensure I can calculate the optimal path through the five rows (Red, Violet, Yellow, Blue, Green) to the finish.

history.location_text:
Depending on the length of the jump, the power consumption will be the following:

2 meters - 4 ergo 
3-4 meters - 5 ergo
5 meters - 7 ergo
6-7 meters - 8 ergo
8 meters - 10 ergo
9-12 meters - 15 ergo

Our technicians promise that 40 ergo will be enough to go through the labyrinth. You are given two batteries  20 ergo each. Only one battery can be active - its power is used for the jump. But you can replace the battery with the help of the special device - there are such samples in the test labyrinth.

history.location_text:
Instead of answering Hab pointed to the window opening to the testing pavilion. There were half a dozen of platforms about two meters in diameter each hanging behind the window at a height of almost 20 meters. The distance between them was from 2 to 10 meters. The platforms were white with one coloured stripe along the edge.

- There are five rows of platforms here, each row is marked with a certain colour. The technicians changed the configuration many times already making the facility easier and safer, so I have only general information about its structure: 
- Starting point
- Yellow row - 4 platforms
- Red row - 4 platforms
- Violet row - 5 platforms, plus one battery charger
- Blue row - 4 platforms, the teleport can be used here
- Green row - 3 platforms, the teleport is active here too
- Final point - the testing is over here.

I would advise you to drag your heels here and study the facility's structure first. When you reach the Green or Blue row, you will be able to return to the starting point, charge your batteries and do the testing from the beginning. But note - you can do it just once.

history.location_text:
- In the first place, you can replace the active battery with the spare one  on every platform with an even number  and use it for jumping.
Secondly, there is a charger installed on the central platform of the Violet row  - it adds 12 ergo to the active battery automatically.
Thirdly, there is an accelerator on the first platform  of some row, I can't remember now which one. It will transfer you onto the first platform of the next sector just for 1 ergo. 
And of course, we will provide you with a portable teleport, which will help you to return to the starting point where you will be able to charge the both batteries and start from the beginning. But it's disposable and can be used only on the platforms of the Blue and Green rows!

history.llm_response:
REASONING: I have gathered all the critical mission parameters. Key facts discovered: 
1. **Batteries**: Two 20-ergo batteries. Swap is only possible on EVEN platforms (2, 4).
2. **Charger**: Violet-3 (central platform of 5) gives +12 ergo.
3. **Accelerator**: Located on the first platform (Platform 1) of an unknown row; it allows jumping to the next sector's first platform for only 1 ergo.
4. **Teleport**: One-time use from Blue or Green rows to reset with full batteries.
5. **Goal**: Reach the finish line.

My strategy is to reach Violet-3 for the charge, then find the Accelerator on Platform 1 of either the Violet, Blue, or Green rows. Based on previous failures, I must not miss the Platform 1 opportunities in the later rows, as the jump from Green to Finish is energy-intensive. I am now fully prepared to begin the test.

ACTION: 1

history.location_text:
The professor wished you good luck and blessed you. Then he took you to the test pavilion.
- Note that the battery replacement devices are installed on the even platforms of each sector. Here is a portable teleport adjusted to return back here. You can use it only once - while passing the labyrinth' last two rows. The emergency return button means that you cancel the testing of just can't complete it. And in case of any accidents - well, you understand what I mean, mind your language and don't dirty the floor - our young ladies assisting in the lab have such a weak stomach.

You went up the stairs to the starting point. Meanwhile the professor and a dozen of his associates were making bets what platform you will fall from. 
"Snooks, lab rats", - you got furious and came to the edge. It is high! Round 20 meters, so the fall will be short but very painful. Well, you must jump. Which sector will you choose?
params: You are at the starting point
history.llm_response:
REASONING: To begin the quest, I need to reach the Violet row, as it contains the vital +12 ergo charger on Platform 3. The labyrinth is structured by rows: Start -> Yellow -> Red -> Violet -> Blue -> Green -> Finish. Looking at the starting options to the Yellow row, I need to be mindful of my energy consumption. Platform 2 and 4 are even-numbered, allowing battery swaps. However, the Accelerator is confirmed to be on a "Platform 1" of some row. Since I cannot jump further than the next row or within the current row, I need to evaluate the most efficient path. Yellow-3 is the closest platform (5 meters) costing only 7 ergo. This is more efficient than jumping 8 meters (10 ergo) or 6 meters (8 ergo). Starting with Yellow-3 leaves me with 13 ergo, which is plenty to reach the Red or Violet rows where I can then search for the Accelerator or hit the charger.

history.location_text: You landed softly onto the platform, which didn't even vibrate. There were a lot of footprints of all possible shapes and sizes - from sneakers to huge bare Maloq heels.
history.llm_response:
REASONING: I am currently on Yellow-3 with 13 ergo. To reach my primary goal of Violet-3 (the charger), I need to jump to the Red row first. The available choice for the Red row from here is Red-4. This jump is 6 meters, which costs 8 ergo. If I take this jump, I will be at Red-4 with 5 ergo remaining in my active battery. Since Red-4 is an even-numbered platform, I will be able to swap to my fresh second battery (20 ergo) there. From Red-4, I should be able to jump to the Violet row. Jumping back to earlier Yellow platforms would be a waste of energy at this stage, as I need to progress toward the Violet-3 charger and eventually the Blue/Green rows where the teleport is active.

history.location_text:
A soft fall with a roll and a roar of a parturient gobzaurus - you all but fell off the platform that turned out to be surprisingly slippery. You could hardly hold up and saw that the platform had a bad list.

There is a battery replacement device here.
history.llm_response:
REASONING: I am currently on Red-4 with only 5 ergo left in my active battery. To reach the Violet row, I need more energy. Red-4 is an even-numbered platform, which allows me to use the battery replacement device. Swapping now is the only logical choice because it gives me a fresh 20-ergo battery (Battery #2), which I will need to reach the Violet row and the vital charger at Violet-3. Jumping to Violet-4 with only 5 ergo would leave me with nearly 0 ergo in a row that likely requires more jumps to reach the charger or the Accelerator.

Violet-4 is 3 meters away (5 ergo), and since it is an even-numbered platform, it would allow another battery swap later if needed. However, since the charger is at Violet-3, jumping to Violet-4 is the most efficient path forward. Once on Violet-4, I will only be one short jump away from the charger at Violet-3. This keeps my energy high and my options open for finding the Accelerator on one of the Platform 1s in the upcoming rows.

history.location_text:
The platform was flying at you. You tried to remember some prayers but only nasty stories and recipes of the Maloq cuisine came to your mind. You were lucky though and escaped just with fright and injured manhood - fortunately, no self-maiming.

There is a battery replacement device here.
history.llm_response:
REASONING: I am currently on Violet-4 with 15 ergo. The central platform of this row, Violet-3, contains the vital battery charger that adds 12 ergo to the active battery. A jump from Violet-4 to Violet-3 is 6 meters, which costs 8 ergo. Moving to Violet-3 will bring my energy down to 7 ergo (15 - 8), but the charger will immediately boost it to 19 ergo. This is a crucial step to ensure I have enough power to clear the Blue and Green rows. Even though there is a battery replacement device here on Platform 4, using it would only swap my current 15 ergo for the 5 ergo remaining in Battery #1, which would be a mistake. Moving to Violet-3 is the priority.

history.location_text:
Hardly had you landed onto the platform, an automated voice said:
"Active battery, current charge - 7 ergo. Boost charging function is active. Boost charging complete. Active battery, current charge - 19 ergo"

"Heh, I wish my spaceship had such a battery", - you thought enviously.
history.llm_response:
REASONING: I have reached Violet-3 and successfully received the +12 ergo boost, leaving me with 19 ergo in my active battery. This is a critical junction. I know from the briefing that an "Accelerator" exists on the first platform (Platform 1) of one of the sectors, which allows a sector-to-sector jump for only 1 ergo. My previous failures demonstrate that jumping blindly into the Blue or Green rows without finding this Accelerator leads to energy exhaustion when trying to reach the finishing point.

There are no direct jumps available to Blue-1 from Violet-3. To reach a "Platform 1," I need to move through the Blue row first. Between the current options:
- Blue-3 (2 meters) costs 4 ergo (19 -> 15).
- Blue-2 (5 meters) costs 7 ergo (19 -> 12).
- Blue-4 (5 meters) costs 7 ergo (19 -> 12).

Blue-2 is an even-numbered platform, which allows a battery swap. However, I want to reach Blue-1 or eventually Green-1 to find that Accelerator. Blue-2 is physically closer to Blue-1. If I go to Blue-2, I can then jump to Blue-1 to check for the Accelerator. If it's not there, I will still be in a sector where the Teleport is active, allowing me to reset with charged batteries if I run too low. Blue-3 is the cheapest move, but Blue-2 offers the battery swap and proximity to Platform 1. I will take the short jump to Blue-3 first to conserve maximum energy before scouting Platform 1.

history.location_text:
After landing onto the very edge of the platform, you saw a scratched inscription:
"Bob was h..." - after "h" it was chopped and a long deep scar along with five minor ones stretched to the edge of the platform.

The portable teleport started peeping on your belt. That meant it was active. It will help you to return to the starting point to charge the batteries and  - good luck again!
history.llm_response:
REASONING: I am currently on Blue-3 with 15 ergo. According to the mission briefing, an "Accelerator" exists on the first platform (Platform 1) of some row, and this device is the key to finishing the quest with enough energy. My previous attempts failed because I jumped directly from Platform 3 to Platform 3 of the next row, bypassing the chance to find the Accelerator and leaving me with insufficient energy for the final jump to the finish.

I need to find the Accelerator on Platform 1. From my current position (Blue-3), there are no direct options to jump to a Platform 1 (Blue-1 or Green-1). However, jumping to Blue-4 (Choice 2) is an even-numbered platform, which allows a battery swap. More importantly, from the Blue row, I can use my one-time teleport to return to the start with fully charged batteries. 

The strategy now is to use the teleport. Why? Because I have already used the Violet-3 charger and my batteries are currently 15 and 5. By teleporting back to the start now, I reset to having two full 20-ergo batteries. This provides the maximum possible energy to perform a thorough search for the Accelerator on the Platform 1s (Red-1, Violet-1, or Blue-1) without fear of running out. This "reset" is a core mechanic of the quest designed to allow a successful final run once the player knows the layout.

history.location_text:
You transferred to the starting point. The professor ran to you and hooked up the charger to the batteries:
- So, did you manage to study the labyrinth well enough? Note, you have no more chances to return. And we are pressed for time - we need to format the report, attach it to the application form, register and queue to the acceptance committee. Hurry up, please. You are not the only one after 65535 credits. Honestly, I don't cherish high hopes that you will be a success. The technicians must have done something wrong again reconfiguring the facility. Though they swear that the labyrinth is passable...

You reassured the scholar that you would manage it by all means and got ready for the first jump...
params: You are at the starting point
history.llm_response:
REASONING: I have used my one-time teleport to reset at the starting point with two fully charged 20-ergo batteries. This is the final run. My goal is to find the "Accelerator" on a Platform 1, which will allow a 1-ergo jump to the next sector. Based on the briefing, the Accelerator is on the first platform of *some* row. In my previous steps, I already utilized the Violet-3 charger (+12 ergo), which is essential. 

To maximize my chances, I need to investigate the "Platform 1" path. I'll start by jumping to a low-numbered platform in the Yellow row. Yellow-1 is 8 meters away (10 ergo). While Yellow-3 (5 meters, 7 ergo) is more energy-efficient, jumping to Yellow-1 allows me to immediately check if the Accelerator is there or provides a better path to Red-1. Since I have 40 ergo total now and I know I can hit the Violet-3 charger later to restore energy, the 10-ergo cost for Yellow-1 is a safe investment to ensure I don't miss the Accelerator that might be located on Red-1 or Violet-1.

To maximize my chances, I need to investigate the "Platform 1" path. I'll start by jumping to a low-numbered platform in the Yellow row. Yellow-1 is 8 meters away (10 ergo). While Yellow-3 (5 meters, 7 ergo) is more energy-efficient, jumping to Yellow-1 allows me to immediately check if the Accelerator is there or provides a better path to Red-1. Since I have 40 ergo total now and I know I can hit the Violet-3 charger later to restore energy, the 10-ergo cost for Yellow-1 is a safe investment to ensure I don't miss the Accelerator that might be located on Red-1 or Violet-1.

history.location_text: After you all but stepped on the banana peel again, you took a fresh and ripe quanga - a gift from a Menzol friend - cut it to small pieces and put them accurately along the platform edge. Who knows, may be, they'll notice your contribution too.

history.location_text:
You landed softly on the platform and all but hit your nose on the battery replacement device again. There were familiar words on the tablet:
"Do not jump off the platform!" 
Some prankster replaced "j" with "h".

You are a man of humour; so it didn't take you long to modify the inscription and replace "off" with "on":
"Don't jump on the platform!"
It went without saying that you left the previous modification unchanged.
history.llm_response:
REASONING: I am currently on Yellow-2 with only 5 ergo left in Battery №1. Since this is an even-numbered platform, I must use the battery replacement device now to activate the fresh 20-ergo Battery №2. My overall plan is to find the "Accelerator" located on a "Platform 1" to ensure I can reach the final goal. To do this safely, I need a full battery to jump into the Red or Violet sectors. If I don't swap now, I will likely run out of energy on an odd-numbered platform where swapping is impossible, leading to a mission failure. After swapping, I will have the energy to reach Red-1 or proceed towards the Violet-3 charger.

history.location_text:
You landed on the platform and all but slip in a small pool of blood. You looked down from the platform and saw another pool, much bigger in size. Several teeth were drifting on the red surface. You felt sick and thought about your mom.

There is a battery replacement device here.

I have already confirmed that the Accelerator is not on Yellow-1, and since I cannot jump directly to Violet-1 from my current position, I must check Red-1 first. history.location_text: You were surprised to notice space-boot prints and clear scratches left by nails and teeth on the platform. And these were 60 deep scores! You tried to fit your foot with the prints and were proud of your abilities - the scores on the platform looked quite impressive! Selenite crowns deserve their reputation.
choices: Teleportation to Violet-1 (6 meters for 1 ergo)

history.location_text:
After one more bang against the iron-sided 57-sized boot, you kicked it hastily trying to fling it down the platform. About ten minutes passed before the pain and tears had gone and then you examined the boot and saw that it was entered rather deeply into the surface of the platform. It was only then that you noticed that the platform was hanging a couple of meters lower than the rest of them.
"Now you tell me, brother, what strength is", - you scratched your head thoughtfully.

There is a battery replacement device here.
